text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- National electoral commission watchdog maintains decision on distribution of constituencies ahead of communal and municipal elections in June.
- Rabat municipal council examines possibility of transferring water and electricity management to private sector.
- Government examines issues related to reforms of economic and financial sectors.
- Japan grants Morocco $154 million loan for road and water projects.
- African Bank devotes $82.5 million for upgrading Morocco's rail network.
- French Accor group signs agreement with Morocco to invest more than $100 million in tourism sector.
- Morocco draws up long-term strategy to combat drug trafficking in close cooperation with international bodies.
- City of Fez to hold international music show.
- Interior Ministry says 18,794 drug traffickers were arrested, including 342 foreigners, in 1996.
